intro: Aster sibiricus var. meritus, commonly known as the Siberian aster, is a perennial herb native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern Asia. It features a compact, upright growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped, gray-green leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to violet flowers in the late summer and early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy choice for gardens in temperate zones. Its ornamental value and resilience contribute to its popularity among horticulturists and wildflower enthusiasts.
